dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey, B, good to be back! Got some interesting diplomatic news crossing our desks today, uh, from Central Asia, actually.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey, B, good to be back! Got some interesting diplomatic news crossing our desks today, uh, from Central Asia, actually.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, really? Central Asia, huh? That's, like, always a fascinating region for, y'know, international relations. What's up?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, really? Central Asia, huh? That's, like, always a fascinating region for, y'know, international relations. What's up?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Kazakhstan's President, Kassym-Jomart Tokayev, he sent a congratulatory telegram to his Slovenian counterpart, Nataša Pirc Musar.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Kazakhstan's President, Kassym-Jomart Tokayev, he sent a congratulatory telegram to his Slovenian counterpart, Nataša Pirc Musar.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President of Kazakhstan Kassym-Jomart Tokayev has sent a congratulatory telegram to President of Slovenia Nataša Pirc Musar, citing the Akorda press service.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Slovenia, right. Okay. So, what was the occasion? Was it, like, a birthday or something?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Slovenia, right. Okay. So, what was the occasion? Was it, like, a birthday or something?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No, no, uh, not a birthday. It was for Slovenia's national holiday, their "Statehood Day." And, you know, Tokayev was very effusive, saying he's really pleased with the "steady expansion" of their political dialogue.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no, uh, not a birthday. It was for Slovenia's national holiday, their Statehood Day. And, you know, Tokayev was very effusive, saying he's really pleased with the steady expansion of their political dialogue.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tokayev congratulated Nataša Pirc Musar on Slovenia™s national holiday"Statehood Day. I am pleased to note the steady expansion of political dialogue and cultural-economic cooperation between Astana and Ljubljana.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: "Steady expansion," I like that phrase. So, not just politics, but, like, other areas too?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Steady expansion, I like that phrase. So, not just politics, but, like, other areas too?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly! He specifically mentioned, um, cultural-economic cooperation between Astana and Ljubljana. Which, you know, is always good to see.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly! He specifically mentioned, um, cultural-economic cooperation between Astana and Ljubljana. Which, you know, is always good to see.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I am pleased to note the steady expansion of political dialogue and cultural-economic cooperation between Astana and Ljubljana.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] And didn't she, like, just visit Kazakhstan recently? I feel like I remember seeing something about that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And didn't she, like, just visit Kazakhstan recently? I feel like I remember seeing something about that.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: You are absolutely right! He actually brought that up in the telegram, saying he "greatly values" the outcomes of her official visit to Kazakhstan this spring.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You are absolutely right! He actually brought that up in the telegram, saying he greatly values the outcomes of her official visit to Kazakhstan this spring.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I greatly value the outcomes of your official visit to Kazakhstan this spring.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Ah, the spring visit. So, uh, was that a big deal? Were there, like, actual agreements made?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ah, the spring visit. So, uh, was that a big deal? Were there, like, actual agreements made?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, definitely a big deal. They had extended talks, with official delegations from both countries. And Tokayev, um, he's "confident" those agreements will elevate Kazakh-Slovenian relations to a "new level."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, definitely a big deal. They had extended talks, with official delegations from both countries. And Tokayev, um, he's confident those agreements will elevate Kazakh-Slovenian relations to a new level.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kassym-Jomart Tokayev and Nataša Pirc Musar held extended talks with the participation of official delegations from both countries. ... I am confident that the agreements we reached will elevate Kazakh-Slovenian relations to a new level, the message reads.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: "New level," that's a strong phrase for a diplomatic telegram. It sounds like there's some real momentum building there then.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: New level, that's a strong phrase for a diplomatic telegram. It sounds like there's some real momentum building there then.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it really does. I mean, from what we're hearing, the visit itself was on March 31st, so it's all pretty fresh.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it really does. I mean, from what we're hearing, the visit itself was on March thirty first, so it's all pretty fresh.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, on March 31, the Slovenian president arrived in Kazakhstan for an official visit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, a recent high-level visit, followed by a congratulatory telegram citing strong progress. That's, uh, a pretty solid sign of strengthening ties, wouldn't you say?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, a recent high-level visit, followed by a congratulatory telegram citing strong progress. That's, uh, a pretty solid sign of strengthening ties, wouldn't you say?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely, B. It's a clear signal that both nations are, like, committed to deepening their relationship, which is, you know, always good for stability in the region.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely, B. It's a clear signal that both nations are, like, committed to deepening their relationship, which is, you know, always good for stability in the region.
